The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::radix}} is the base of the number system used in the representation of the type. It is {{c|2}} for all binary numeric types, but it may be, for example, {{c|10}} for IEEE 754 {{enwiki|Decimal64 floating-point format|decimal floating-point types}} or for third-party {{enwiki|binary-coded decimal}} integers. This constant is meaningful for all specializations.
